page.title: 01The Hills West Of Cranshaws
page.content: Gently sloping exposed heather hills of the lammermuirs. Vegetation mainly heather moorland, broken by steep sided valleys and squire shelter belts of coniferous trees.Hills and farmland for black face sheep which need to be fed hay in the winter and red grouse is an important game bird. Heather is burnt on a ten year rotation so hillsides have striped appearance sometimes the fern bracken takes the place of heather which is economically undesirable as it is poisonous to livestock. Human habitat restricted to around Cranshaws shepherds & gamekeepers work hard to make ends meet. mature trees being extracted from hill wood and taken to the road where the logs are transported out.
